item.title: Covid: Self-isolation to be scrapped for double-jabbed and children in England
item.description: Under-18s in England also won't have to self-isolate if a close contact tests positive from 16 August.

item.title: School bubbles to be axed in England
item.description: Restrictions in England's schools are axed, as 641,000 pupils miss school due to Covid regulations.

item.title: Wembley park stabbings: Danyal Hussein guilty of murdering sisters
item.description: Danyal Hussein murdered Nicole Smallman and Bibaa Henry in a "demonic deal", his trial heard.

item.title: Euro 2020: Pubs to stay open later for final on Sunday
item.description: Premises will be able to stay open until 11.15pm, in case the game goes to extra time and penalties.

item.title: Raducanu feeling better after Wimbledon retirement
item.description: Emma Raducanu says the "whole experience" of her run to the Wimbledon fourth round "caught up" with her but is now "feeling better" after her mid-match retirement.

item.title: BBC star salaries: Gary Lineker still BBC's top earner despite pay cut
item.description: He agreed to a wage cut last year but Zoe Ball does not leapfrog him as she also took a reduction.

item.title: Vauxhall UK plant safe with electric vehicle plan
item.description: The Ellesmere Port factory will get a Â£100m investment to build electric vehicles and protect 1,000 jobs.

item.title: US left Bagram Airbase at night with no notice, Afghan commander says
item.description: American troops quietly withdrew from the key airbase in the early hours, new base commander says.

item.title: Stockwell Six: Three men have 1972 convictions quashed by Court of Appeal
item.description: The men, jailed for allegedly attempting to rob a policeman nearly 50 years ago, feel 'vindicated'.

item.title: Bank of England asks staff to come in once a week
item.description: Many firms are still not asking staff to return to the office despite restrictions set to end on 19 July.

item.title: State pension predicted to rise by 8%
item.description: The latest forecasts mean the debate about the triple lock guarantee will heat up.

item.title: Covid in India: Tackling lack of online learning in Delhi's slums
item.description: Devanshi, 21, helps children who are at risk of losing school forever - particularly girls.

item.title: France in a fizz over Russia's champagne label law
item.description: A law forcing French fizz makers to label their bottles as sparkling wine has left them bubbling.

item.title: Nintendo Switch OLED Model gets an upgraded screen
item.description: A larger OLED screen is the main feature, with a host of other small improvements to the device.

item.title: Climate change: The craft brewery using algae to cut emissions
item.description: An Australian craft brewery is using microalgae to turn their carbon emissions into oxygen.

item.title: Influencers react to Norway photo edit law: 'Welcome honesty' or a 'shortcut'?
item.description: The rule on clearly labelling posts is part of an effort to "reduce body pressure" on young people.

item.title: 'I have to leave!' - PA interrupts Federer interview
item.description: Eight-time Wimbledon champion Roger Federer jokes during an interview with the BBC as a tannoy announcement interrupts his answers.

item.title: Is busking on TikTok the future?
item.description: Liv Harland live streams herself on TikTok and says she makes a lot more online than on the street.

item.title: London air pollution turned into art to raise awareness
item.description: Marina Vitaglione used a traditional photographic process to create striking images of air pollution in London.

item.title: Bafta-nominated young game designers take on real-world issues
item.description: Bafta's nominees for Young Game Designer of the year tackle important issues for a new generation.

item.title: Boris Johnson: 'If we can't reopen in next few weeks, when will we?'
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson speaks about the final step of England's roadmap out of lockdown.

item.title: Covid-19: 'For us it's not freedom day, is it?'
item.description: Their medical conditions mean they are considered vulnerable to Covid. How are they feeling now?

item.title: Bibaa and Nicole: The life after death of two sisters
item.description: Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman died in a senseless attack. But they should not be remembered as victims.

item.title: Euro semi-final 'very special opportunity'
item.description: England have a "very special opportunity" to make the country happy when they face Denmark in their Euro 2020 semi-final, says Gareth Southgate.

item.title: Riot of cherry blossom reveals new Damien Hirst post-lockdown
item.description: Giant cherry blossom paintings by Damien Hirst contrast with his previous dead animal art.

item.title: India's Covid doctors demand action after attacks
item.description: Doctors are seeking a stringent law to protect them from attacks by angry and frustrated relatives.

item.title: How to get a lucrative job in cybersecurity
item.description: There's a serious shortage of IT security workers, so recruiters are fishing in a bigger pool.

item.title: Rehab in Wales: 'Prison is the safest place for my mum'
item.description: Ex-offenders, experts and support services all want better rehabilitation services in Wales.

item.title: Cavendish wins 33rd Tour stage to close within one of Merckx record
item.description: Mark Cavendish surges to his 33rd stage victory at the Tour de France to move within one win of the all-time record held by Belgian legend Eddy Merckx.

item.title: England working 'on knife edge' after Covid outbreak in ODI squad
item.description: Director of cricket Ashley Giles says England are working on a "knife edge" after their one-day squad was hit by a coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Euro 2020 semi-final - can Spain do a Portugal & can Italy replace Spinazzola?
item.description: Italy and Spain go head to head in a European Championship knockout game for the fourth event in a row - these are the talking points.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: 'It's been the best week of my life' - Emma Raducanu
item.description: Emma Raducanu tells Sue Barker about her whirlwind first Wimbledon experience, her plans for the future, and her score prediction for England v Denmark in the Euros.

item.title: Copa America: Neymar sets up Paqueta for only goal in semi-final
item.description: Neymar's trickery sets up Lucas Paqueta to score the winner for Brazil in their Copa America semi-final win over Peru.

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate and what if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: Self-isolation rules in England are changing from 16 August.

item.title: Some firms to insist customers and staff still wear face masks
item.description: Some customers will still be asked to wear face masks even after it becomes a "personal choice" on 19 July.

item.title: What are the rules about self-isolating, testing and masks in schools?
item.description: From 16 August, under-18s in England will no longer have to self-isolate after exposure to a positive case.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Boris Johnson has set out government plans for lifting the remaining Covid restrictions in England.

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: The prime minister has announced the next steps for easing social distancing in England.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Should I still wear a face mask or covering and what are the rules?
item.description: Wearing a face covering is currently a legal requirement in many places, but rules are changing in England.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: The PM says every adult should have had the chance to be doubled jabbed by mid-September.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: The working from home advice in England is set to change on 19 July.

item.title: Covid: Will free school meals continue over summer holidays?
item.description: A year on from Marcus Rashford's successful campaign, what is the current situation?

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government is considering allowing double vaccinated adults to avoid quarantine after travel.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: 'Coercion and rape': Investigating my yoga school
item.description: Ishleen Kaur was passionate about yoga movement Sivananda, until she found allegations of sexual abuse.

item.title: Benefits and disability: 'I'll never cohabit again, to protect myself'
item.description: Some disabled people have been left uncomfortably reliant on partners after benefits were removed.

item.title: A fake wedding, and a $250,000 scam
item.description: How a British man's dreams of a future with his Ukrainian fiancee ended in financial disaster.
